and Congress. On Dec. 10, Sen. Bernie Sanders , an independent, took the floor of the Senate and didn't relinquish it for 8 1/2 hours. His words are being assembled into a book entitled The Speech: A Historic Filibuster on Corporate Greed and the Decline of Our Middle Class. The book's publisher, Nation Books, says millions followed the speech online, crashing the Senate server. A print book is due out next month. An electronic book will be published Jan. 28.

has so far bested industry expectations, but he added that the automaker was still a long way from meeting its objectives. "Our job is not yet done," Sergio Marchionne said in a statement. We have a lot of work ahead to fulfill our five-year business plan objectives. For 2010, Chrysler reported nearly$ 42 billion in revenue, in line with its November financial projections. Charlotte. The 49ers neutralized Tu Holloway , a player of the year candidate, and handed the Musketeers their first A-10 loss, 66-62. Tu Holloway missed all eight of his three-point tries and went 3 of 17 overall. It's like in football if you're playing Michael Vick , 49ers coach Alan Major told the Charlotte Observer. "You'd rather Michael Vick throw it than run. We'd rather have[ Tu Holloway ] shooting over you rather than driving around you." 9

. The business people would be very comfortable with him." He also doesn't alienate the opposition. "I like Mike Pence ," says former House Speaker Brad Ellsworth Gregg, a Democrat. He is a conservative, but unlike some conservatives he's not angry. I don't find him shaking his finger at a moderate or liberal. He invites discussion and an exchange of ideas. Although Mike Pence 's path to the governor's office appears clear at this point, he's not likely to take it for granted. Mike Pence knows what it's like to lose an election,
